title: Academic Projects
text:
“HokieEats” Food Delivery Service:
I was tasked with creating a database-driven “review management” module for a fictional food delivery service website and integrating it with other team member’s sections of the project. I created 9 webpages using HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, D3.js, Ajax, JavaScript, and Bootstrap, all focused on user review creation, modification, and analysis.
Languages: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Bootstrap, J3.DS, Ajax

Code
View this project on Github

title: About David Corcoran
text:
I graduated from Virginia Tech’s Pamplin College of Business in May 2022 with two degrees in Business Information Technology and Finance, and a minor in Economics. Immediately after graduation, I worked for two years in McLean, VA as a Federal Technology Risk Management Associate at KPMG. In this role, I gained hands-on experience in IT control audit readiness, segregation of duties (SoD), identity and access management (ICAM), and inventory management, where I contributed to improving risk mitigation processes, creating corrective action plan (CAP) downgrade packages, and aligning IT controls with regulatory requirements.
In August 2024, I began to pursue a Masters in Data Science and Analytics at Georgetown University. In this program, I aim deepen my understanding of machine learning, database management, statistics, preditive modeling, and natural language processing (NLP). I am eager to apply my knowledge in data-driven decision-making to future roles in technology, where I hope to leverage the data science concepts I have learned while attending this program.

Work Experience
KPMG - Federal Technology Risk Management Associate
McLean, VA | July 2022 - July 2024






Assisted in the creation of an SoD governance document, recommending IT goverance structure solutions and SoD frameworks
Performed walkthoughs, tests of design, and tests of effectiveness for SAP IT system controls to identify inter-site discrepancies, system errors, and internal control gaps
Completed a corrective action plan (CAP) downgrade package for SoD and ICAM notices of findings and recommendation (NFRs)

The CAP downgrade package consisted of an end-to-end (E2E) process document, control gap analysis, posting logic assessment, risk and control matrix, and responsibility-accountability matrix.

Initiated a DoD agency’s enterprise-wide SoD and ICAM implementation effort, involving the creation of a program governance charter, current-state SoD/ICAM assessment, and Microsoft PowerBI monitoring dashboard



TIC Summer Camp - Python Programming Counseler
McLean, VA | June 2021 - August 2021






Taught campers aged 6 - 18 Python programming funamentals (variables, syntax, loops, functions, classes) using Processing 3

title: Personal Projects
text:
Soccer League Data API
A program that accesses football-data.org’s soccer API to retrieve the current standings of Europe’s top 5 soccer leagues. It will prompt the user to select which league they want to view, and has validation rules for inputs outside of the given league list. Once a list is chosen, the program accesses the API to display that league’s current standings and offers an additional lookup.
Languages: Python

Code
View this project on Github



 Spotify Top Tracks:
Utilizing Spotipy and Spotify’s API to retrieve song/artist data from an inputted Spotify account, this python program returns the selected user’s top 25 tracks and artists within 3 different time periods: 4 weeks, 6 months, and all-time. Users must create an account on Spotify for Developers to obtain an API key.
Languages: Python

Code
View this project on Github
